topic.title: Instance terminology
topic.shortdesc: Actual documents, topics, and elements are, when created, referred to as instances of the DITA model.

body.p: When actual documents, topics, and elements are created based on a DITA document type, the following terminology is used:JTH Define specialized element, specialized attribute here?

dlentry.dd: An occurrence of an element type in a document.
An occurrence of an attribute type in a document.
An occurrence of a topic type in a document.
An occurrence of a map type in a document.
An occurrence of a topic type or a map type in a document.

A document whose meaning and validity are determined by a document type declaration.This is not the same as the definition of document instance in the XML spec. In particular, there is no requirement in XML that a document instance be valid (or have a doctype declaration or explicitly-associated schema) and DITA has (or should have) no such requirement either (because it isn't necessary and is unenforceable).
